content:
• Tuesday, November 8, 2016

  • Odds of December rate hike plunge

    • Prior to tonight's election results, short-term rate markets had priced in about a 100% chance of the Fed boosting interest rates next month.
    • With a Trump victory looking more likely, U.S. stock index futures are down more than 4%, the 10-year Treasury yield is off 12 basis points, and Fed Funds futures are now pricing in less than a 50% chance of a December move.
    • ETFs: SHY, BIL, VGSH, SHV, SCHO, SST, DTUS, TUZ, DTUL, RISE, GBIL
    • #Election2016
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 PM | 32 Comments

  • Treasury and gold prices surge on Trump strength

    • Alongside a swoosh down in stocks and the peso, the 10-year Treasury yield has tumbled a full 10 basis points to 1.75%, and gold has popped higher by 2.8% to $1,310 per ounce.
    • At the moment, Trump is holding onto a slim lead in Florida with the votes nearly all counted. He's also begun to pull ahead in Ohio, and is showing surprising strength in Virginia. North Carolina and New Hampshire are as close as can be.
    • ETFs: GLD, TBT, TLT, IAU, PHYS, TMV, SGOL, UGL, DGP, TBF, GTU, UGLD, GLL, EDV, TMF, DZZ, GLDI, TTT, OUNZ, ZROZ, DGL, DGZ, DGLD, VGLT, TLH, UBT, DLBS, TLO, GYEN, GEUR, UBG, VUSTX, DLBL, TYBS, QGLDX
    • #Election2016
     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 PM | 40 Comments
  • ARWR

    FDA places clinical hold on Arrowhead's mid-stage study of lead product candidate in hepatitis B e antigen-positive patients

    • Arrowhead Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARWR) announces that it has received verbal notice from the FDA that the agency has placed a clinical hold on its Phase 2 Heparc-2004 study assessing lead product candidate ARC-520 for the treatment of patients with chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection who are also positive for e antigen (HBeAg). A clinical hold means that no additional patients can be recruited for the study and all dosing must stop in patients currently enrolled.
    • The action stems from questions related to a nonclinical toxicology study in non-human primates using the company's liver-targeted intravenously administered delivery vehicle called EX1. Specifically, there have been deaths at the highest dose, which is higher than that used in humans and higher than those used in previous animal toxicology studies. The specific cause of the animal deaths is being investigated.
    • The company says the FDA did not indicate that the hold was related to human data. It adds that EX1 has been administered over 800 times in more than 300 human subjects and patients with only three serious adverse events reported. About 6% of infusions have been associated with infusion reactions.
    • EX1 is also the delivery vehicle used in Arrowhead's ARC-521 and ARC-AAT programs.
    • ARC-520 is an RNAi therapeutic that intervenes upstream of the reverse transcription process where current standard-of-care nucleotide and nucleoside analogs act and is designed to silence the production of all HBV gene products.
    • Shares are holding steady after hours.
    • Update: Shares are down 17% premarket on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 PM | 24 Comments
  • RGR

    Gun stocks extend recent gains as election results pile in

    • Sturm Ruger (NYSE:RGR) is up 1% and Smith & Wesson (SWHC) gained 2.3% in an after-hours session that factored in some of the exit polling from the election.
    • Both stocks have accelerated over the last week into the election. SWHC +10.7% over the five sessions and RGR +8.4%.
    • #Election2016
     
     
     
     
    | 8:23 PM
  • ENT

    Global Eagle -3.5% as revenues miss; company enters China JV

    • Global Eagle Entertainment (ENT +2.1%) has slipped 3.5% in late trading after its Q3 revenues came up light despite growing by a third.
    • The company also entered into a joint venture to provide services in China, with Shareco, of HNA Group. Shareco plans to invest up to $416M in Global Eagle (at $11/share, vs. closing price of $8.19) through primary and secondary purchases.
    • Revenues got a boost from the company's purchase of Emerging Markets Communications.
    • Revenue by segment: Content, $79M (down 3.1%); Connectivity, $67.9M (up 137.9%).
    • For the full year, it now sees revenue of $530M-$538M (light of an expected $541M), adjusted EBITDA of $61M-$65M (vs. consensus for $76.3M) and capex of $45M-$50M.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:46 PM | 2 Comments
  • SSP

    Scripps sets new $100M buyback program

    • E.W. Scripps (SSP +3.7%) has authorized a new repurchase program for up to $100M of its class A common shares.
    • The company's last authorized buyback program expires Dec. 31. The new authorization runs from Jan. 1, 2017, to Dec. 31, 2018.
    • The company can buy back shares from time to time in the open market or through trading plans or private block transactions.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:53 PM
  • CMLS

    Cumulus Media +3.6% as revenue tops expectations

    • Cumulus Media (NASDAQ:CMLS) is up 3.6% after hours after Q3 earnings came in with revenue that beat expectations despite a slight decline.
    • Net revenues dropped 1.1% to $286.1M, and adjusted EBITDA fell 37.9% to $43.9M -- but excluding $14.4M in expenses tied to resolving disputes with CBS Radio, it declined 17.5%.
    • "Though our performance in the quarter was negatively impacted by headwinds which have challenged us all year, we see evidence that our work is paying off financially as we gained share this quarter for the first time in at least four years," says CEO Mary Berner.
    • Revenue breakout: Radio Station Group, $206.2M (up 0.7%); Westwood One, $79.4M (down 5.5%).
    • Net income by segment: Radio Station Group, $134.1M; Westwood One, -$10.87M; Corporate and other, -$76.9M.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:48 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: SAEX +20.8%. ARTX +6.4%. PINC +4.0%. VSAT +2.9%. KND +2.4%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: TRIP -13.2%. GMED -10.2%. JAZZ -3.4%. CPA -3.0%. COMM -2.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • VSAT

    ViaSat +3.6% after strong Q3 with doubled profits

    • ViaSat (VSAT +0.6%) is up 3.6% after hours following a strong beat with its fiscal Q2 earnings.
    • The company tallied a record backlog in its Government Systems segment and hit record revenues in Satellite Services. Net income more than doubled to $11M on a GAAP basis, and grew 37% to $20.3M on an adjusted basis.
    • EBITDA rose 7.7% to $93.2M and beat an expected $87.8M.
    • Revenue by segment: Satellite Services, $156.3M (up 11.5%); Commercial Networks, $65.5M (down 1.4%); Government systems, $177.4M (up 20.9%).
    • Along with results, the company said it's been selected by a North American airline to retrofit more than 500 aircraft from its mainline fleet with ViaSat's in-flight Internet. That installation is expected to begin next summer.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • XXII

    22nd Century EPS in-line, beats on revenue

    • 22nd Century (NYSEMKT:XXII): Q3 EPS of -$0.03 in-line.
    • Revenue of $3.09M (+15.7% Y/Y) beats by $0.19M.
    • Shares +3.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM | 5 Comments
  • TRIP

    TripAdvisor -14%; Q3 revenue off expectations, EPS meets

    • Results – revenue $421M (+1% Y/Y, consensus $436.31M), EPS $0.53, adjusted EBITDA $114M (-12% Y/Y), net income $78M, cash flow used in operations $87M, free cash flow -$108M
    • Operational metrics – average MAUs 390M (+11% Y/Y), user reviews and opinions 435M (+50% Y/Y)
    • TripAdvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP) president and CEO Steve Kaufer: "In the third quarter, content and community grew quickly off of massive bases and we continued improving our products and our platform. We are focused on building for the long-term, delivering the best end-to-end user experience in travel and creating more value for partners in our marketplace."
    • Prior quarters overview
    • Prepared remarks
    • Supplemental financials
    • Conference call
    • Presentation
    • 10-Q
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM | 3 Comments

  • API: U.S. crude inventories up 4.4M barrels

    • Trade expectations had been for just a 1.6M barrel increase in stockpiles. Oil initially fell on the news, then rose, and then fell again. It's now at $44.77 per barrel - roughly the level it was at prior to the report.
    • USO +0.1% after hours
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UWTI, UCO, DWTI, SCO, BNO, DBO, DTO, UGA, USL, DNO, OLO, UHN, SZO, OLEM, OILK, OILX
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 17 Comments
  • NXST

    Nexstar +1.9% as Q3 hits record revenues

    • Nexstar Broadcasting Group (NASDAQ:NXST) gained 1.9% despite Q3 profits that hit a record but missed expectations.
    • As with other station chains, results got extraordinary boosts from the Olympics and political revenues in this election season. Revenues grew 23.6% overall with strength in local advertising but also from retrans fees and digital gains.
    • Revenue breakout: Core revenue of $131.4M was up 4.4% (Local, up 7.8% to $94.9M; National, down 3.6% to $36.5M). Political revenue, $25.5M (up 895%); Retransmission fees, $98.3M (up 22.8%); Digital, $28.6M (up 42.2%); Trade and Barter, $11.6M (up 0.5%); other, $1.5m (up 5.3%).
    • The company's exceeded its full-year guidance for political revenues, CEO Perry Sook says; combined with core, retrans and digital growth, "As a result, we remain confident in our guidance for Nexstar to generate record free cash flow in 2016, and on a stand-alone basis, the company is well on pace to achieve our guidance for annual average 2016/2017 free cash flow of $250 million – or average pro-forma free cash flow of $8.15 per share per year."
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • MBI

    MBIA gains after earnings beat

    • Q3 combined operating income of $5M or $0.04 per share vs. $24M and $0.15 one year ago.
    • Adjusted book value per share of $32.39 vs. $29.69 at start of year, mostly thanks to the buyback of 16.6M shares at prices far below book (though no shares bought back in Q3). Today's close was $7.79.
    • U.S. Public Finance Insurance operating income of $24M down from $48M a year ago, mostly thanks to a $35M adverse variance in losses and loss adjustment expenses (Puerto Rico). Net premiums earned of $60M fell 12% Y/Y. National Public Finance insured $339M of new business gross par exposure in Q3 vs. $129M a year ago. Net investment income of $29M flat Y/Y.
    • Conference call tomorrow at 8 ET
    • Previously: MBIA beats by $0.11, beats on revenue (Nov. 8)
    • MBI +3.1% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • SODA

    M&A talk lifts Craft Brew Alliance and SodaStream

    • SodaStream (NASDAQ:SODA) and Craft Brew Alliance (NASDAQ:BREW) both ended the day with solid gains on what appears to be buying related to some M&A speculation.
    • A report from Brazil on 3G reloading for another major acquisition drove up food stocks today as well.
    • SodaStream closed up 7.17% to $27.80 vs. a 52-week trading range of $11.66 to $30.70.
    • Craft Brew Alliance rose 5.15% to $14.35 vs. a 52-week trading range of $6.80 to $22.40.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 4 Comments
  • VALE

    Vale-BHP Samarco JV misses second debt deadline

    • The Samarco iron ore joint venture of Vale (VALE +5.1%) and BHP Billiton (BHP +3.2%) has missed a second coupon payment on dollar bonds and exceeded the grace period on the first payment, according to Gimme Credit.
    • Samarco parents Vale and BHP are said to be in disagreement over what action to take for their iron ore pellet joint venture, while prosecutors in Brazil continue to seek damages from the company and its backers, which are reportedly maintaining the operations even if they are not paying the debt interest coming due, Gimme Credit says.
    • The Samarco deadly tailings dam disaster happened one year ago, leaving behind a horribly polluted river that locals will have to contend with for decades to come.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 8 Comments
  • TALO

    Stone Energy +30% after earnings, updates on liquidity and bonding

    • Stone Energy (SGY +31.1%) surges following Q3 results that saw its net loss narrow to $89.6M from a $292M loss in the year-ago period, and Q3 production volumes of 39K boe/day exceeded the upper end of company guidance.
    • SGY says it is continuing to work towards a restructuring support agreement that would position it for a pre-packaged bankruptcy filing and eliminate ~$850M in outstanding debt.
    • SGY says it was in compliance with all covenants under its amended bank credit facility as of Sept. 30, but the minimum liquidity requirement and other restrictions may prevent it from meeting its Q4 interest payment obligation on its notes due 2022.
    • SGY also said it has proposed to the U.S. Bureau of Ocean Energy Management a tailored plan that would call for $30M-$40M in bonding to cover its obligations for plugging and abandonment in the Gulf of Mexico.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM

  • Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: IOTS +25%. ICAD +14%. SNCR +14%. NTNX +13%. MXL +12%.
    • Losers: MODN -23%. SCSC -14%. MOMO -13%. KONE -11%. NH -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • MDLZ

    Powerful rally in food stocks on report of 3G reloading

    • Food stocks are getting gobbled after a report circulates indicating that 3G is prepping for another acquisition.
    • Sources tell Brazil Journal that 3G is raising between $8B and $10B for the new deal.
    • Gainers on the day include Mondelez International (MDLZ +4%), G. Will Food-International <<WILC,>> Kraft Heinz (KHC +2.8%), Pilgrim's Pride (PPC +2.9%), Lifeway Foods (LWAY +1.2%), Pinnacle Foods (PF +0.8%), Tyson Foods (TSN +1.4%), Seneca Foods (SENEB), Campbell Soup (CPB +3.6%), General Mills (GIS +3%), Kellogg (K +2.8%), Flower Foods (FLO +1.4%) and J.M. Smucker (SJM +1.1%).
    • The PowerShares Dynamic Foods & Beverage ETF (NYSEARCA:PBJ) is up 1.93% on the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 41 Comments
  • EBIX

    Patriot National rejects Ebix offer; shares jump 15%

    • Ebix (EBIX -0.8%) this summer had initially offered $9.50 per share for Patriot National (NYSE:PN), later enhancing that to a total enterprise value of $475M (which likely would have exceeded that $9.75 valuation).
    • The Patriot board today rejects that $475M proposal, and will continue to evaluate other more attractive offers, and any other opportunities for value creation.
    • PN +14.75% to $6.54.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM | 19 Comments
  • ESTE

    Earthstone Energy +20% following earnings, merger with Bold Energy

    • Earthstone Energy (ESTE +19.8%) shoots ~20% higher after reporting a lighter than expected Q3 loss and a merger deal with fellow Permian Basin player Bold Energy.
    • The combined company will own 26,800 net surface acres plus ~715 gross drilling locations in the Midland Basin, as well as 18,600 net surface acres in the Eagle Ford shale in south Texas.
    • Current production of the combined company is estimated 7,400 boe/day (63% oil), with 46% coming from the Midland Basin and 38% from the Eagle Ford.
    • When completed, the deal will give current ESTE stockholders ~39% of the combined company, with Bold members owning the remaining 61%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM

  • Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: SGY +28%. ESTE +21%. KRO +17%. CETC +16%. EMES +15%.
    • Losers: CGG-OLD -28%. TDW -10%. SWN -7%. MT -6%. MTRX -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • REN

    Resolute Energy rallies on production gains, shaking off surprise Q3 loss

    • Resolute Energy (REN +13.3%) surges after reporting a 36% Q/Q increase in Q3 average daily production, overcoming a surprise Q3 loss and revenue that missed analyst estimates.
    • REN recorded a $1.24/share net loss for the quarter, badly trailing expectations but narrowing a $2.44 loss during the year-ago Q3.
    • In addition to the production gain to 16K bbl/day, including 10K-plus bbl/day from its Permian Basin operations, REN reduced its lease operating expense by 37% Y/Y and 23% Q/Q to $11.20 per barrel.
    • REN also said it recently received an offer for its remaining non-core assets in New Mexico and was expecting to complete that deal before year-end.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM | 7 Comments
  • GTN

    Gray Television at two-year lows as political ads ding earnings

    • Gray Television (NYSE:GTN) has slid 9.2% to two-year lows after rolling out Q3 earnings where revenues missed despite 35% growth to a record total, and profits were far off expectations.
    • Revenues grew 35% to $204.5M, with a boost from political revenue (though not entirely due to those ads), but core revenue was flat (inventory displacement came from politics and the Olympics). Political revenue unsurprisingly jumped 385% to $22.3M -- still a disappointment.
    • "This year's political election season presented extraordinary challenges from the top of the ticket to the bottom, especially after mid-September," said CEO Hilton H. Howell. "These challenges created a 'perfect storm' for our political revenue."
    • For Q4, it's guiding to revenue of $230M-$237M (well below consensus for $250.1M), featuring political ad revenue of $47M-$48M.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • PRBCF

    Synaptics -5.6% on Samsung Electronics, Precise Biometrics arrangement; Cowen and Company considers oversold

    • Precise Biometrics (OTCPK:PRBCF) and Samsung Electronics (OTC:SSNLF) entered a partnership in which the former will provide fingerprint software for Samsung's sensor solutions. The development has in turn led to concern Synaptics may lose business from Samsung because of it.
    • Cowen and Company's Robert Stone, however, isn't moving on a $75 target (current price $51.84) and Outperform rating for Synaptics on the news. Notes Samsung has utilized a combination of hardware algorithms in the past and that software generally comprises a comparably small piece of overall value. Additionally sees Samsung developing an under-glass design for the forthcoming Galaxy S8 and believes a tight hardware, software integration will be necessary. Assumes Synaptics would remain involved in sensor and software supply should that be the case.
    • Syanptics (NASDAQ:SYNA) shares had fallen nearly 10% earlier in the day, though have reversed 5.86% upward intraday since that point.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM | 1 Comment

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: AMRK +10%. XIN +8%.
    • Losers: OMF -39%. CIA -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • KMX

    Auto retailers and lenders, subprime finance mull plunges at Hertz, OneMain Holdings

    • Hertz is well off its lows, but still down 32%  after disappointing earnings and a guidance cut, with the company noting the declining value of it cars. OneMain Holdings has plunged 38% after slashing guidance.
    • Lower in this wake are rental and leasing names, and auto retailers like CarMax (KMX -4.2%). Finance companies are also getting under pressure: Credit Acceptance (CACC -1.8%), Santander Consumer (SC -4.4%), Ally Financial (ALLY -1.7%).
    • Yesterday's Fed senior loan officer survey alluded to incremental caution on auto and credit card lending standards, says Evercore's John Pancari. The survey also showed a slight "down-shift" in auto-loan demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • BRS

    Bristow downgraded at Barclays as discount refinancing options narrow

    • Bristow Group (BRS -1.5%) is downgraded to Equal Weight from Overweight with a $16 price target, cut from $20, at Barclays, citing the company's inability to discount capital markets risk for its refinancing options.
    • Barclays says that when it upgraded BRS in June, it was optimistic about the potential for a sale leaseback of the company's U.K. SAR assets to potentially either dedicated helicopter lessors or other financiers given the assets were tied to a 10-year U.K. government contract.
    • BRS never set any expectations about the timing of such a sale leaseback and still considers the ~$300M of U.K. SAR aircraft the most likely source of liquidity, but Barclays says Brexit and the resulting weakness in the British pound makes this more challenging, and lessors would have to get more comfortable with BRS's credit risk.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • CTWS

    Connecticut Water Service beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • Connecticut Water Service (NASDAQ:CTWS): Q3 EPS of $0.84 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $29.48M (+3.7% Y/Y) beats by $0.42M.
    • Shares +1.75%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: SGY +28%. IOTS +27%. OSIR +26%. ESTE +23%. FLKS +21%. NL +20%. CLDX +19%. ACAD +18%. KRO +17%. ICAD +16%.
    • Losers: BIOS -47%. OMF -39%. KND -33%. HTZ -31%. CGG-OLD -29%. RMTI -28%. FSTR -25%. MODN -24%. APEI -23%. MATX -21%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • EWW

    'Trump ETF' signals Clinton is the winner

    • Flat for the early part of the session, the iShares MSCI Mexico ETF (EWW +2.1%) has spiked upwards in the last 90 minutes. This comes on top of a 5.2% advance yesterday amid a stalling in polling momentum for Trump.
    • Alongside, the peso has risen to its strongest level vs. the dollar since late September.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 5 Comments
  • QRTEA

    Liberty Interactive +5% following Q3 earnings

    • Liberty Interactive (QVCA) has gained 5% partway into its conference call after posting Q3 earnings where revenues fell at QVC Group, but Liberty Ventures provided a boost.
    • The Liberty Ventures (LVNTA +2.3%) unit finished a split-off of Liberty Expedia Holdings (LEXEA +0.9%), which distributed $300M to Liberty Interactive.
    • Revenue by segment, QVC Group: QVC US, $1.34B (down 6%); QVC International, $610M (up 4%); zulily, $359M (new).
    • Gross margins were down: at QVC US, 35.2% from 36.4%; at QVC International, 37% from previous 38.4%. Zulily's margin was 28.4%.
    • E-commerce revenue rose 2% at QVC Group to $882M; mobile made up 59% of that, vs. last year's 53%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM

  • Stocks spike higher in late morning action

    • Down modestly for most of the morning, the major averages have bounced nearly 1% in the last hour or so, with the S&P 500 now higher by 0.65%, the Nasdaq by 0.85%, and the Dow by 0.75%.
    • Alongside that is a move upward in bond yields with the 10-year Treasury ahead 4 basis points to 1.87%.
    • This Turnout Tracker from Slate shows things looking good for the Clinton camp.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM | 3 Comments
  • CRAY

    Cray upgraded to Buy at Needham & Company; +5%

    • Price target set at $25 (current price $21.25).
    • Analyst Richard Kugele notes that despite continued downward estimate revisions, considers Cray (NASDAQ:CRAY) to be "finally nearing the end of the majority of the revisions with nearly all needed wins for 2016 secured and 5 key remaining systems out at customers awaiting final fix of some lingering issues and signoff."
    • Further sees advantageous opportunity to own shares at current levels amid the lowered move in outlook.
    • Hold rating prior.
    • Q3 report
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 4 Comments
  • HL

    Hecla Mining +5.5% after strong Q3, higher production outlook

    • Hecla Mining (HL +5.5%) is sharply higher after beating analyst estimates for Q3 earnings and revenues, and adjusted EBITDA of $75.2M soared 323% higher than in the prior-year quarter.
    • HL reports total Q3 silver production of 4.3M oz. surged 67% Y/Y, gold production of 52K oz. jumped 19%, and silver equivalent production of 10.3M oz. was a 17% Y/Y gain.
    • The Q3 average realized silver price was $19.53/oz., up 34% Y/Y, and the average realized gold price was $1,341/oz., up 20% Y/Y.
    • HL raises its FY 2017 total silver production to 16.25M oz. from an earlier outlook of 15.8M oz., while keeping its view of total gold production unchanged at 233K oz.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • T

    Oppenheimer downgrades AT&T, expecting drawn-out Time Warner review

    • Oppenheimer's downgraded AT&T (T +0.5%) on the prospect that the FCC could jump in with the Justice Dept. on a review of the telecom's $85B deal for Time Warner (TWX +0.1%).
    • And that deal review should be a long slog, says Tim Horan: lasting into 2018, he figues, during which time he expects AT&T stock to be range-bound.
    • The DOJ suing the company over the Dodgers' TV channel is an "ominous sign," he says, and the FCC will likely want a piece due to the approach to "zero rating" of the DirecTV Now streaming service.
    • He reduced the firm's rating on shares to Market Perform. Meanwhile, seeing a more attractive dividend at CenturyLink (CTL +4%), Horan upgraded CTL to Outperform. Oppenheimer has a $30 price target, implying near 24% upside from today's higher price.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM | 20 Comments

  • Consumers - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 12:10 PM

    • Gainers: JCI +6%. FARM +5%. AOI +5%.
    • Losers: STLY -16%. LFVN -7%. ANDE -7%. ICON -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • CEMP

    Analysts split on Cempra; price target range: $5 - 40

    • Unsurprisingly, analysts have a range of opinions regarding Cempra (CEMP -12.4%) after Friday's close Ad Comm vote on solithromycin.
    • On the bullish side, WBB Securities, RBC Capital Markets and Needham all rate the stock a Buy with price targets of $40 (567% upside), $27.50 (358% upside) and $15 (150% upside) (from $36), respectively.
    • Three shops downgraded: Morgan Stanley from Overweight to Underweight with a $5 (17% downside risk) price target (from $35); Jefferies from Buy to Hold with a $10 (67% upside) price target (from $36) and Gabelli from Buy to Hold.
    • The day before the Ad Comm review, Stifel Nicolaus and JPMorgan downgraded it to Hold and Neutral, respectively, with price targets of $8 (33% upside)(from $37) and $6 (0% upside)(from $25), respectively.
    • Shares have lost 67% of their value since last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 36 Comments
  • SNHY

    Sun Hydraulics +11% after Baird upgrade

    • Sun Hydraulics (SNHY +11.1%) is upgraded to Outperform from Neutral with a $35 price target, raised from $27, at Baird, a day after Sun reported a slight Q3 earnings miss but issued upside Q4 EPS guidance of $0.21-$0.23 on r~$46M in revenues.
    • Sun has agreed to buy the Power Controls and Vehicle Technologies lines of business from Enovation Controls for $200M, a deal Baird says appears to meaningfully upgrade Sun's electrical controls and display capabilities while broadening end markets into consumer and military applications; Sun expects the purchase to be $0.25-$0.35/share accretive in 2017.
    • Baird says the deal marks an important shift in strategy under Sun's new CEO, with meaningful growth to the tune of $1B in revenue targeted by 2025, half through M&A.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • SNCR

    Synchronoss Technologies +12%; Q3, outlook encouraging

  • BHP

    BHP says lost three weeks copper output due to South Australia blackout

    • BHP Billiton (BHP +2.7%) says it lost about three weeks worth of production from its Olympic Dam copper mine in Australia due to a power outage in September, placing the mine's original FY 2017 production guidance of 200K metric tons under review.
    • A massive blackout in South Australia state on Sept. 28 forced BHP to suspend production in order to divert back-up power to maintain essential operations.
    • Based on copper prices of $4,800/ton at the time, BHP lost ~$2.6M/day in production during the shutdown.

  • HTZ

    Dizzying fall for Hertz Global after earnings

    • It's not a 2-for-split  for Hertz Global (NYSE:HTZ), but a complete collapse in investor confidence after the company reported weak earnings and issued soft guidance. Shares are currently down 49.5% from yesterday's close.
    • CEO John Tague explained the misery best: "A customary vehicle depreciation rate review near the close of the third quarter resulted in a substantial depreciation adjustment, particularly on compact and mid-sized vehicles, that together with rental volume at the low end of our expectations as well as higher net operating and administrative expenses impacted our performance."
    • Deutsche Bank was caught in the line of fire with a Buy rating into the earnings report (reset to Neutral today), while Carl Icahn may be scratching his head after boosting his Hertz stake five months ago.

  • ONCS

    OncoSec Medical's ImmunoPulse IL-12 shows positive effect in PD-L1 inhibitor-resistant melanoma patients; shares up 7%

    • Thinly traded nano cap OncoSec Medical (ONCS +6.9%) jumps out of the blocks this morning on increased volume in response to its announcement of positive interim results in a mid-stage study assessing ImmunoPulse IL-12 and Merck's (MRK -0.5%) KEYTRUDA (pembrolizumab) in patients with unresectable metastatic melanoma. The data will be presented on November 11 at the Society for Immunotherapy of Cancer Annual Meeting in National Harbor, MD.
    • In 15 patients determined to be unlikely to respond to a PD-1 inhibitor alone, 40% (n=6/15) responded to treatment with ImmunoPulse Il-12 and KEYTRUDA. The group included four complete responders and two partial responders.
    • ImmunoPulse IL-12 delivers a pulsed electric field to cells via a hand-held applicator which temporarily increases the porosity of the cell membranes (electroporation). DNA IL-12 is then delivered to the electroporated cells which triggers each cell to produce and secrete IL-12 protein which then identifies and eliminates cancer cells as part of a natural immune response.
    • Pembrolizumab helps the immune system fight tumor cells by blocking the interaction between PD-1, a cell surface receptor expressed on T cells and pro-B cells, and its ligands PD-L1 and PD-L2. PD-1 is an immune checkpoint which down regulates the immune system. Blocking its action activates the immune system to attack cancer cells.

  • MT

    ArcelorMittal warns on lower U.S. steel prices, higher coking coal costs

    • ArcelorMittal (NYSE:MT) -6.7% premarket after reporting a Q3 earnings beat and a 40% jump in EBITDA to $1.9B, despite a 6.8% drop in revenue to $14.5B.
    • But MT warns that lower steel prices in the U.S., combined with the impact of rapidly rising metallurgical coal prices on steel spreads in other areas, likely will lead to a Q/Q decline in profitability in Q4.
    • Prices of coking coal, one of the main ingredients in steelmaking, have nearly tripled to ~$236/metric ton in the past five months on declines in output in China and Australia, partly related to poor weather.
    • Taking into account an expected full year investment in operating working capital of ~$1B, raised from its earlier outlook of ~$500M, MT expects cash flows from operating activities to exceed capex in 2016.
    • For Q3, MT says steel shipments totaled 20.3M tons, a seasonal decline of 8.1% vs. Q2; steel shipments for the first nine months totaled 63.9M tons, down 1.5% Y/Y.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:26 AM | 1 Comment
